title: Turkey claims its first town as offensive into northern Syria intensifies
text:
(CNN) Turkish forces took control of their first town in northern Syria on Saturday, the defense ministry said, as the country's offensive intensifies.

The Turkish military tweeted that it had seized Ras al-Ain on the border "as a result of ongoing successful operations within the scope of the Peace Spring Operation."

But the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) disputed this, with commander Mervan Qamishlo telling Reuters that the group had conducted a "tactical retreat" from one neighborhood of Ras Al Ain, before "very fierce clashes" restarted.

Smoke rises over the Syrian town of Ras al-Ain, as seen from the Turkish border town of Ceylanpinar.

It comes days after Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan launched the incursion into Syria to drive Kurdish forces -- a key US ally against ISIS -- away from the border and to use the area to resettle around 2 million Syrian refugees.

Dozens of civilians have been killed since Turkey began launching airstrikes and artillery fire across the border. And according to the SDF, 45 of its fighters have been killed since Wednesday. It also says its resistance killed 118 Turkish-backed forces on Friday.
